    • Method Detail

      • getComponent

        public <T extends com.badlogic.ashley.core.Component> T getComponent(java.lang.Class<T> component)
        Internal and simple way of getting Ashley components. This allows you to add your own components (using ZbeEntity.add(component)) without having to create your own ZbeEntity class
        Parameters:
        component - component class to get e.g. ResourceComponent.class
        Returns:
        the instance of the component belonging to this entity

      • update

        public void update(float deltaTime)
        The entity's update loop, put your entity's logic here
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - elapsed time between the last frame and this frame

      • createAnimationFrames

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion[] createAnimationFrames(java.lang.String framesName,
                                                                  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture spriteSheet,
                                                                  int columns,
                                                                  int rows)
        Creates and registers an array of frames from a sprite sheet. Retrieve with getAnimFrames(name); Designed to be used with createAnimation() for sprite sheets with multiple animations.
        Parameters:
        framesName - name for the frames
        spriteSheet - animation sprite sheet. Assumes all frames are of equal size. //TODO explicit sizing
        columns - number of columns in the sprite sheet
        rows - number of rows in the sprite sheet
        Returns:
        the created array of frames

      • createAnimation

        public ZbeAnimation createAnimation(java.lang.String animName,
                           com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion... frames)
        * Creates and registers a new animation from the provided frames. The animation can be retrieved by name using getAnimation(name);
        Parameters:
        animName - name to register the animation under
        frames - frames to create an animation from
        Returns:
        the created animation

      • createAnimation

        public ZbeAnimation createAnimation(java.lang.String animName,
                           com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture spriteSheet,
                           int columns,
                           int rows)
        Creates and registers a new animation from a sprite sheet for the particular animation. The animation can be retrieved by name using getAnimation(name); Note that animation frames are automatically created and registered with the name 'animName_frames'
        Parameters:
        animName - name to register the animation under. The animation frames are registered with the name 'animName_frames'
        spriteSheet - animation sprite sheet. Assumes all frames are of equal size. //TODO explicit sizing
        columns - number of columns in the sprite sheet
        rows - number of rows in the sprite sheet
        Returns:
        the created animation

      • getAnimation

        public ZbeAnimation getAnimation(java.lang.String animName)
        Gets a previously registered animation
        Parameters:
        animName - name of the registered Animation
        Returns:
        the Animation instance

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion[] getAnimationFrames(java.lang.String framesName)

        Parameters:
        framesName - name of the registered frames
        Returns:
        the array of frames

      • getAnimationFrames

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion[] getAnimationFrames(java.lang.String framesName,
                                                               int startFrame,
                                                               int endFrame)
        Gets a part of a previously registered set of animation frames as defined by startFrame and endFrame
        Parameters:
        framesName - name of the registered frames
        startFrame - start frame inclusive (from 0)
        endFrame - end frame inclusive (from 0)
        Returns:
        the array of frames

      • setSpriteDimensions

        public ZbeEntity setSpriteDimensions(int width,
                            int height)
        Set custom dimensions for the entity's sprite. Useful for using bounds smaller/larger than the set sprite. Default is the entity's bounds dimensions.
        Parameters:
        width - desired sprite width in pixels
        height - desired sprite height in pixels
        Returns:
        current ZbeEntity instance

      • collides

        public ZbeEntity collides(ZbeEntity entity,
                 java.lang.String entityType,
                 float x,
                 float y)
        Check if source entity is colliding with any entity of type entityType
        Parameters:
        entity - entity to check collision for
        entityType - entity type to check collisions with
        x - x position of the source entity's bounds
        y - y position of the source entity's bounds
        Returns:
        the collided entity

      • collides

        public ZbeEntity collides(ZbeEntity entity,
                 java.lang.String entityType)
        Check if source entity is colliding with any entity of type entityType. Uses the entity's position for x and y
        Parameters:
        entity - entity to check collision for
        entityType - entity type to check collisions with
        Returns:
        the collided entity
